revised_title: Volcanic Eruption in Sunda Strait and Its Aftermath
tldr: The author reports on the volcanic eruption in Sunda Strait and its aftermath, including the destruction of Thwart-way Island, extensive fields of floating pumice stones, and the formation of new islands. The surrounding area is covered in greenish-yellow mud, and all traces of vegetation are destroyed. The captain of the Netherlands frigate "Queen Emma" believes another eruption may be imminent, with Verlaten Island being the center of disturbance.
